title: SEAFORT / DESERTER BONUS
description:
Extra open threads

LOGIC (INT) red check

dialogueTree.title: Composure: "What strikes you about this gaunt m..."
dialogueTree.text: What strikes you about this gaunt man is not the stomach pain, or the cough, or the malnutrition. It's precisely what you could *not* see before. For a man who's spent 44 years hidden in the urban wild...

links.title: You: "He is surprisingly okay."
links.text: He is surprisingly okay.

links.title: Composure: "Indeed. He speaks fluidly, his move..."
links.text: Indeed. He speaks fluidly, his movements are rapid, if erratic. His voice, despite the cough, is there. It is capable of expressing complicated ideas. Above all, he seems *animated*.

links.title: You: "Animated? By what?"
links.text: Animated? By what?

links.title: Composure: "It's a mystery. This animation come..."
links.text: It's a mystery. This animation comes at a cost too: erratic hand gestures, thought processes cut off like threads, as he just stares at the logs or the reeds. He also suffers mood swings, bubbling to the surface, unconstrained by his nervous system.

links.title: Empathy: "Great leaps of emotion: from anger..."
links.text: Great leaps of emotion: from anger to grief, despair...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "And also flashes of lust, simmering..."
links.text: And also flashes of lust, simmering in there. Not too common in people his age.

links.title: You: "Dementia?"
links.text: Dementia?

links.title: Composure: "You've seen demented people before...."
links.text: You've seen demented people before. This feels similar, yet different. When his thoughts move they are lucid, keen even -- not senile.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Is it some kind of substance damage..."
links.text: Is it some kind of substance damage? Like he's addicted to something -- not only the painkillers he's clearly on.

links.title: You: "Wouldn't a foul temper be a by-prod..."
links.text: Wouldn't a foul temper be a by-product of his life?

links.title: Empathy: "Perhaps. But his seems more than th..."
links.text: Perhaps. But his seems more than that. The inner turmoil takes unexpected turns, as if forced on him in a way...

links.title: Composure: "In summary, you sense some underlyi..."
links.text: In summary, you sense some underlying neurological disorder.

links.title: You: "The lust. Wouldn't his *glands* hav..."
links.text: The lust. Wouldn't his *glands* have... stopped by now?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "There is definitely something hormo..."
links.text: There is definitely something hormonal there. Whatever the condition he's suffering, there is a sexual element to it.

links.title: You: ""Mr. Dros, are you on some kind of..."
links.text: "Mr. Dros, are you on some kind of a psychoactive substance?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""No!" he snaps out of staring throu..."
links.text: "No!" he snaps out of staring through you. "I won't be stuffed full of shit like the rest of this city."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You said you take painkillers..."..."
links.text: "You said you take painkillers..." The lieutenant follows your lead.

links.title: The Deserter: ""I take them to cope with pain. The..."
links.text: "I take them to cope with pain. The people of this city use painkillers, because they have *pain*. Untreated illnesses, not enough money for a greedy doctor."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Are you sure about him being lucid?..."
links.text: Are you sure about him being lucid? Maybe he's just affected by an extreme case of *socialism*.

links.title: Rhetoric: "He is indeed very lucid at times.."
links.text: He is indeed very lucid at times..

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Didn't he say..."
links.text: Didn't he say...

links.title: You: ""You said you take painkillers...""
links.text: "You said you take painkillers..."

links.title: You: "No matter."
links.text: No matter.

links.title: Composure: "It's not a downer. Rather an upper,..."
links.text: It's not a downer. Rather an upper, judging by his snaps.

links.title: You: ""How about pyrholidon?""
links.text: "How about pyrholidon?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""I don't know what that is..." He s..."
links.text: "I don't know what that is..." He shakes his head.

links.title: You: ""Are you on amphetamines?""
links.text: "Are you on amphetamines?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Like some kind of decadent rock st..."
links.text: "Like some kind of decadent rock star?" He doesn't dignify it with more of an answer.

links.title: You: ""Mr. Dros, are you okay? How is you..."
links.text: "Mr. Dros, are you okay? How is your memory?" (Finish the examination.)

links.title: The Deserter: ""No I'm not *okay*..." He waves his..."
links.text: "No I'm not *okay*..." He waves his hand, chasing something that's not there. "I shit blood and I'm surrounded by insane people..."

links.title: Composure: "There it is again -- erratic hand m..."
links.text: There it is again -- erratic hand motions. Bouts of rage. And the stomach thing too of course...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Could it be a symptom of overdosing..."
links.text: Could it be a symptom of overdosing on something? Something even you have not tried? Keep your eyes peeled.

dialogueTree.title: Composure: "What strikes you about this gaunt m..."
dialogueTree.text: What strikes you about this gaunt man is not the stomach pain, or the cough, or the malnutrition. For a man who's spent 44 years hidden in the urban wild...

dialogueTree.title: Composure: "Aside from the rare erratic hand ge..."
dialogueTree.text: Aside from the rare erratic hand gesture, smacking his lips and despondently staring into the fire, you can only see that he is old.

dialogueTree.title: Composure: "For a sixty-year-old man with stoma..."
dialogueTree.text: For a sixty-year-old man with stomach trouble -- who's spent his entire life alone on an uninhabited island -- he seems surprisingly fit.

links.title: You: "That's it? (Squint at him.)"
links.text: That's it? (Squint at him.)

links.title: Composure: "He's clearly a drug user of the pai..."
links.text: He's clearly a drug user of the painkillers sort, prone to erratic hand gestures -- and malnourished. But that's it. The moment passes and you say...

links.title: Composure: "He's prone to erratic hand gestures..."
links.text: He's prone to erratic hand gestures -- and clearly malnourished. But that's it. You can see no more by looking at his slouched frame. The moment passes and you say...

dialogueTree.title: The Deserter: ""A tragicomedy..." He shakes to lif..."
dialogueTree.text: "A tragicomedy..." He shakes to life. "Druggies, prostitutes and rentiers."

links.title: Composure: "A strange little engine seems to fi..."
links.text: A strange little engine seems to fire up in him again. It straightens his back.

links.title: Conceptualization: "The familiar *put put put* of hatre..."
links.text: The familiar *put put put* of hatred.

links.title: Half Light: "Detest pushes the cobwebs out of hi..."
links.text: Detest pushes the cobwebs out of his eyes, pushes the melancholy aside. He relishes it.

links.title: You: ""More specifically?""
links.text: "More specifically?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Specifically, the whole city is a..."
links.text: "Specifically, the whole city is a charnel house, stripped clean and draped in neon. But Martinaise..." he shakes his head in grave disgust, "Martinaise is the worst."

links.title: You: ""How come?""
links.text: "How come?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Because of the *racists*. Everyone..."
links.text: "Because of the *racists*. Everyone is a racist in Martinaise, it's their favourite thing to do in the whole world -- listening to race-themed radio shows. In the ruins, in their lorries." He points inland.

links.title: The Deserter: ""Pumped full of steroids and Radio..."
links.text: "Pumped full of steroids and Radio Revachol '92. Race this, race that... It's all sanctioned by that social democratic Union and the farce of a social democrat who runs it..."

links.title: You: ""Mr. Claire?""
links.text: "Mr. Claire?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Yes, the fly larva in his containe..."
links.text: "Yes, the fly larva in his container. He let some nihilistic advertising yuppies erect a statue of Filippe III -- a syphilitic murderer -- on the town square. To spit on the working class."

links.title: You: ""Anything more?""
links.text: "Anything more?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Not since the serfs of ancient Per..."
links.text: "Not since the serfs of ancient Perikarnassis has History produced a more *inert* social class than the Martinaise proletariat. The rest of Revachol at least *pretends* to rebuild, these people still live in ruins..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""In tents, like animals..." He poin..."
links.text: "In tents, like animals..." He points to the church. "Like those boom-boom-morons on the ice. A pity they didn't drown in that tent of theirs." He keeps shaking his head with sorrow for the sight he missed.

links.title: You: ""That all?""
links.text: "That all?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""The worst of them is the blood-dre..."
links.text: "The worst of them is the blood-drenched *soucriant* on her yacht, licking her lips. The old whore's gone now, her gun toting porcelain men are dead -- so, actually, no..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""The *worst* is that old cock parad..."
links.text: "The *worst* is that old cock parading around in his uniform, throwing balls all day. It's not enough that the racists and liberals are dancing on our graves! The old loyalist ghouls still parade the ruins too."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Every morning he's there. While th..."
links.text: "Every morning he's there. While the parasites he fought to protect are off in Ozonne, or Croyant-Morain, or some other island they've built their palaces on. Feeding on drugs and having sex with their own children."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: The Deserter: ""That's all the rich *really* want..."
links.text: "That's all the rich *really* want -- sex with their own children. Throughout history -- even the royal bloodline of the Suzerain! --  it's all just an excuse for them to have sordid sex. At least that old cunt Frissel is now dead..."

links.title: You: ""Mhm. Now -- I have some questions..."
links.text: "Mhm. Now -- I have some questions about this..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""We did good when we pushed him und..."
links.text: "We did good when we pushed him under the horse car. Until, in the Thirties, those disco whores..." He breathes in, his breath heavy with hatred, you cannot make out a single word.

links.title: Half Light: "The disco whores are too much; hatr..."
links.text: The disco whores are too much; hatred shuts down his brain's language centre, leaving only a nonsensical sputter.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "What was that about *steroids*? It..."
links.text: What was that about *steroids*? It piqued your interest...

links.title: Conceptualization: "There was something about a statue,..."
links.text: There was something about a statue, and nihilistic advertising agency people? Might be worth investigating...

links.title: Reaction Speed: "And the soucriant, on *her* yacht -..."
links.text: And the soucriant, on *her* yacht -- Joyce? Probably...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Boom-boom morons on thin ice, going..."
links.text: Boom-boom morons on thin ice, going under -- those are the tent kids!

links.title: Volition: "Ask about that 'cock on parade' too..."
links.text: Ask about that 'cock on parade' too. Make sure you get everything here.

links.title: You: ""Disco... whores?""
links.text: "Disco... whores?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""I don't even care about those whor..."
links.text: "I don't even care about those whores anymore..." He stares despondently into the reeds. "Get it over with. Take me in."

links.title: Suggestion: "René must have been quite a loss fo..."
links.text: René must have been quite a loss for him. Maybe you could still get him to talk about things that don't require as much rage... because it's not there anymore.

links.title: The Deserter: ""Whores..." is all he says. Even th..."
links.text: "Whores..." is all he says. Even that word has to be pushed through his teeth with great force. The rage seethes too hard.

links.title: Logic: "He *could* be referring to Joyce in..."
links.text: He *could* be referring to Joyce in her youth. They must have listened to disco when they came here... but it's hard to say.

links.title: Endurance: "Or maybe it's just his body and min..."
links.text: Or maybe it's just his body and mind giving up on him, at last...

links.title: You: ""Hmmm... and the racist on the gate..."
links.text: "Hmmm... and the racist on the gates, pumped full of steroids?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Yes -- *steroids*. A racist on ste..."
links.text: "Yes -- *steroids*. A racist on steroids."

links.title: You: ""You mean Measurehead, right? What..."
links.text: "You mean Measurehead, right? What is your opinion on him?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""What is my *opinion*? You think th..."
links.text: "What is my *opinion*? You think the rich man has an opinion on this idiocy? Is the rich man on the radio, telling you his opinion?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""No," he answers for you. "The rich..."
links.text: "No," he answers for you. "The rich man's looking at real estate and fiddling his kids. Wading through the corpses..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Ha, yes, but he was *there*. Why wa..."
links.text: Ha, yes, but he was *there*. Why was he *there* if you can't have an opinion?!

links.title: You: ""By the way, I have internalized hi..."
links.text: "By the way, I have internalized his *weltanschauung*."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Oh, I'm sure you have *all* intern..."
links.text: "Oh, I'm sure you have *all* internalized your fair share of *racism* at the RCM. You don't have to tell me. It shows. Can't stop talking about some kind of head-measuring man..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant gives you a nod. Go..."
links.text: The lieutenant gives you a nod. Go on, he seems to say.

links.title: Suggestion: "Keep talking about the head-measuri..."
links.text: Keep talking about the head-measuring man. Politics yields information from this man, gets him spilling facts.

links.title: Cuno: "Cuno squints into the distance, con..."
links.text: Cuno squints into the distance, confused. "Walterschlong?" he whispers to himself.

links.title: You: ""Then why was he *there*?""
links.text: "Then why was he *there*?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Scratching away at the race questi..."
links.text: "Scratching away at the race question... You Moralintern monkeys keep the conversation going on Channel 4, helping the rich man conduct his swindle with this inanity."

links.title: The Deserter: ""You think the rich man cares about..."
links.text: "You think the rich man cares about your little race games? He rules the whole world. And he laughs at your moral soliloquies." He stares into the dead embers.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Now wait a moment. Let's get seriou..."
links.text: Now wait a moment. Let's get serious here.

links.title: You: ""Let's get serious for a moment. Th..."
links.text: "Let's get serious for a moment. This is the *real world* -- and in the real world it *means* something if your skin is a certain colour and you say things."

links.title: The Deserter: ""I've seen the *real world*. In '06..."
links.text: "I've seen the *real world*. In '06. The flags unfolding. Young people marching, being kind to each other. They dreamt of a million years in the stars. This here..." He looks down at the ashes. "Is pale in waiting."

links.title: You: ""Pale in waiting?""
links.text: "Pale in waiting?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""The end." He nods. "The pale will..."
links.text: "The end." He nods. "The pale will swallow all of this. The water, the sky, the city. Soon. There is nothing to be serious about." He shakes his head. "We're all gone."

links.title: You: ""Got it.""
links.text: "Got it."

links.title: You: "Yeah no. Enough of that, this isn't..."
links.text: Yeah no. Enough of that, this isn't going anywhere.

links.title: You: ""You're right. I too am a level hea..."
links.text: "You're right. I too am a level headed moral person, unaffected by Measurehead."

links.title: The Deserter: ""I find it strange that you keep br..."
links.text: "I find it strange that you keep bringing this up. You moralist types are eternally fascinated with these race topics. Helping the ruling class conduct their swindle."

links.title: The Deserter: ""The rich man doesn't care about *c..."
links.text: "The rich man doesn't care about *complexion*. He rules the world. And he laughs at your moral soliloquies." He stares into the dead embers.

links.title: You: ""I for one *do* have an opinion on..."
links.text: "I for one *do* have an opinion on Measurehead that people need to hear. And it's not positive."

links.title: The Deserter: ""You moralist types are all cryptof..."
links.text: "You moralist types are all cryptofascists, eternally fascinated with lurid race topics. Helping the ruling class conduct their swindle, keeping the inane conversation going on Channel 4."

links.title: You: ""Did you notice that he is not..."..."
links.text: "Did you notice that he is not..." (Point toward the general area of your face.)

links.title: The Deserter: ""Old? An alcoholic?" With each word..."
links.text: "Old? An alcoholic?" With each word he squints a bit more. "Fascist?"

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Not everyone is." He nods. "Most p..."
links.text: "Not everyone is." He nods. "Most people are *young* and that. The rich man took everything from you, lumpenproletariat. Except your bottle..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""And your race garbage. You can kee..."
links.text: "And your race garbage. You can keep that too, keep the conversation going for the rich man, on Channel 4, eroding working class solidarity." He stares into the dead embers.

links.title: You: ""No. I meant..." (Keep pointing to..."
links.text: "No. I meant..." (Keep pointing to your face.) "Generally reddish and pink, like me."

links.title: The Deserter: ""You're obsessed with your own feat..."
links.text: "You're obsessed with your own features," he shakes his head, "because it's all you have left. The rich man took everything from you. Except your bottle."

links.title: The Deserter: ""And he left you here -- gesturing..."
links.text: "And he left you here -- gesturing at your swollen face. The rich man rules over you and over the world. And he laughs at your fidgeting." He stares into the dead embers.

links.title: You: ""Got it.""
links.text: "Got it."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Steroids and radio shows..." His v..."
links.text: "Steroids and radio shows..." His voice trails off into a despondent sputter. "Probably that Revachol 98AM that's *irradiating* the lumpen, it's the worst..."

links.title: You: ""There was something about the stat..."
links.text: "There was something about the statue on the roundabout -- and syphilis?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Frissel the First, Filippe the Sec..."
links.text: "Frissel the First, Filippe the Second, what's the difference? Syphilitic murderers the lot. I don't want to think about those things anymore. I'm tired of all of it!"

links.title: Half Light: "The flame of anger dulls in him. He..."
links.text: The flame of anger dulls in him. He tires of it, all of it...

links.title: The Deserter: ""Syphilis is a disease Filippe III..."
links.text: "Syphilis is a disease Filippe III contracted in a whore house," he fires quickly. "The statue is an abomination."

links.title: You: ""Abomination?""
links.text: "Abomination?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""The bacteria entered his brain and..."
links.text: "The bacteria entered his brain and made him squander trillions on sparkling wine, *cocainum*, and monuments of himself. His son Filippe IV the Insane contracted syphilis in the womb..." he breathes in with a wheeze of hatred.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "That is technically possible, altho..."
links.text: That is technically possible, although Filippe III was not actually syphilitic, he was just mad.

links.title: The Deserter: ""And he *still* went on to govern R..."
links.text: "And he *still* went on to govern Revachol for twenty five years! We lost 2 million lives toppling that mode of government -- and those grotesque statues too, hundreds of them..."

links.title: You: ""But it's still there.""
links.text: "But it's still there."

links.title: The Deserter: ""What a keen remark!" He sputters...."
links.text: "What a keen remark!" He sputters. "Yes it is, isn't it?! It's still there. Do you know *why*?"

links.title: You: ""Because you forgot to take it down?""
links.text: "Because you forgot to take it down?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Forgot?!" he spreads his arms. "Th..."
links.text: "Forgot?!" he spreads his arms. "The Party had each of the 141 Filippian monuments detonated with plastic explosives. We were *pedantic* about carrying out the order. No..." He points toward the city.

links.title: The Deserter: ""Some advertising cockroaches used..."
links.text: "Some advertising cockroaches used their accumulated capital to erect a new, ironic version of it." He shakes his head in disgust: "Art is a bourgeois establishment. It's an affront to humanity."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wait, the bullet hole in Filippe's..."
links.text: Wait, the bullet hole in Filippe's heart! The statue had been shot -- that was him!

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It had to be, he's already proven c..."
links.text: It had to be, he's already proven capable of taking a far more complicated shot from here.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The bullet hole in Filippe's heart...."
links.text: The bullet hole in Filippe's heart... he'd been shot in the heart. By him?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Forget about that! Something much m..."
links.text: Forget about that! Something much more noteworthy goes off in your brain! Could it not have been that...

links.title: You: ""It was you. You shot the statue --..."
links.text: "It was you. You shot the statue -- there was a bullet hole in his heart..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""I did." He nods. "A needless, sent..."
links.text: "I did." He nods. "A needless, sentimental gesture. I should have spared the bullet for a deformed monster of liberal capitalism. Shameful really..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes. Shameful." The lieutenant tak..."
links.text: "Yes. Shameful." The lieutenant takes a quick note. "So many others to *punish* over the years -- isn't that right, detective?" He turns to you.

links.title: You: ""Actually, it was not de-constructe..."
links.text: "Actually, it was not de-constructed so much as *captured in the moment of the explosion*."

links.title: The Deserter: ""What are you talking about?" The a..."
links.text: "What are you talking about?" The ancient communard cocks his head.

links.title: You: ""It's not a monument to Filippe III..."
links.text: "It's not a monument to Filippe III anymore -- it's a monument to the monument of Filippe III exploding."

links.title: The Deserter: ""What is this madness?" A dim light..."
links.text: "What is this madness?" A dim light comes on in his eyes...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant, too, has cocked his..."
links.text: The lieutenant, too, has cocked his head and is looking at you with a strange expression.

links.title: You: ""It's not madness. It's a monument..."
links.text: "It's not madness. It's a monument to what you did. To your program of de-statuing Revachol."

links.title: The Deserter: ""So you're saying it's... a *commun..."
links.text: "So you're saying it's... a *communist* monument now?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "Not only."
links.text: Not only.

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Maybe you're right..." His dark ey..."
links.text: "Maybe you're right..." His dark eyes fill with the sudden understanding. "That *is* how dialectics work. But understand this -- art is *still* a bourgeois institution."

links.title: The Deserter: "He coughs, then adds, in a gravelly..."
links.text: He coughs, then adds, in a gravelly voice. "And they should all still be sent to Yekokataa."

links.title: You: ""Yes, and furthermore -- the design..."
links.text: "Yes, and furthermore -- the design bureau people are probably left wing too. They often are."

links.title: The Deserter: ""We did always have the prettiest p..."
links.text: "We did always have the prettiest posters... Maybe you're right." His eyes fill with understanding. "That *is* how dialectics work. But understand this -- art is *still* a bourgeois institution."

links.title: You: ""I don't know. Maybe it's too far f..."
links.text: "I don't know. Maybe it's too far fetched."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Of course it is. Delusional bourge..."
links.text: "Of course it is. Delusional bourgeois musings. Everything is some kind of *subversion* on the way to the bank." He waves you off. "All artists -- on a train to Yekokataa."

links.title: You: ""Of course. Straight to Yekokataa.""
links.text: "Of course. Straight to Yekokataa."

links.title: The Deserter: ""You know, you don't sound like a l..."
links.text: "You know, you don't sound like a liberast anymore. Maybe I was wrong..." He measures you with his black eyes. "Maybe I will be escorted to prison by another Mazovian communist -- as I should."

links.title: You: ""As you ought to. *Communism* style.""
links.text: "As you ought to. *Communism* style."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Straight to Yekokataa for this old..."
links.text: "Straight to Yekokataa for this old revisionist." He gives you a little nod. "At last -- atonement for my sins: revisionism, reactionary ideation, desertion..."

links.title: Suggestion: "He still refuses to believe you sub..."
links.text: He still refuses to believe you subscribe to Mazovian socio-economics, but entertaining the thought has given him some measure of solace.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Camaraderie even. For a second ther..."
links.text: Camaraderie even. For a second there he feels less alone -- but then the second passes.

links.title: You: ""You're wrong. I'm no communard. I'..."
links.text: "You're wrong. I'm no communard. I'm a cop."

links.title: The Deserter: ""For a middle-class cop you're damn..."
links.text: "For a middle-class cop you're damn good at getting information out of an old revisionist deserter. Go ahead," he gives you an acknowledging little nod.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mhm," the lieutenant hums. "Straig..."
links.text: "Mhm," the lieutenant hums. "Straight to the open pit mine. Or cleaning up radiation in Severnaya Zemlja."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Yes, well..." the ancient communar..."
links.text: "Yes, well..." the ancient communard sizes you both up, not sure what to think of it.

links.title: Suggestion: "The smallest doubt takes root in hi..."
links.text: The smallest doubt takes root in him -- perhaps this cop is... no, it can't be. This has helped your standing in his eyes.

links.title: You: ""I don't know about that. Could we..."
links.text: "I don't know about that. Could we not?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Don't be squeamish. It is *commonp..."
links.text: "Don't be squeamish. It is *commonplace* to relocate the workforce as the need arises. All nations do it. It's called settlement." He shakes his head and mumbles: "Some kind of bourgeois art-fascist..."

links.title: You: ""Typical far left treachery, repres..."
links.text: "Typical far left treachery, repressing your own people."

links.title: The Deserter: ""It is *commonplace* to relocate th..."
links.text: "It is *commonplace* to relocate the workforce according to the needs of the land. All nations do it. It's called settlement." He shakes his head and mumbles: "Browbeating from the bourgeois art-fascist..."

links.title: You: ""Never mind.""
links.text: "Never mind."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Delusional art bourgeois..." He wa..."
links.text: "Delusional art bourgeois..." He waves you off.

links.title: You: ""That's it for the statue then. Tel..."
links.text: "That's it for the statue then. Tell me, Mr. Dros..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""The fat Union-man let them put it..."
links.text: "The fat Union-man let them put it there. Corrupt as he is. Probably got a fat check for it too, shared with *the law*..."

links.title: Authority: "Accusations of corruption. Push the..."
links.text: Accusations of corruption. Push them aside with a sharp change of topic, officer! Put the heat on *him*.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Hmm... he keeps having *opinions* a..."
links.text: Hmm... he keeps having *opinions* about the Union's leadership.

links.title: Inland Empire: "You feel like you're forgetting som..."
links.text: You feel like you're forgetting something... never mind. It's not important. Push on!

links.title: Conceptualization: "Wait! It suddenly strikes you... pe..."
links.text: Wait! It suddenly strikes you... perhaps it was not as it seemed?

links.title: You: ""Because the king is holy and his s..."
links.text: "Because the king is holy and his statues are indestructible."

links.title: The Deserter: ""The king was a congenitally deform..."
links.text: "The king was a congenitally deformed adulterer. The Party had his monuments detonated with plastic explosives. That one was *especially* destructible..." He points toward the city.

links.title: The Deserter: ""Until some *advertising* cockroach..."
links.text: "Until some *advertising* cockroaches used their accumulated capital to erect a new, ironic version of it." He shakes his head in disgust: "Art is a bourgeois establishment. It's an affront to humanity."

links.title: You: "Say: "Because the king is holy and..."
links.text: Say: "Because the king is holy and his statues are indestructible." (But mean it ironically.)

links.title: The Deserter: ""No, cynical *design* cockroaches l..."
links.text: "No, cynical *design* cockroaches like you erected a new, ironic version of it. We tore it down with honest working class plastic explosives -- but there it is again, grinning..." He shakes his head in disgust.

links.title: The Deserter: ""Art is a bourgeois establishment...."
links.text: "Art is a bourgeois establishment. It's an affront to humanity. Every gallery should be bulldozed and the artists should all be given 30 years of hard labour in Yekokataa."

links.title: You: ""Because cynical advertising yuppie..."
links.text: "Because cynical advertising yuppies erected a *deconstructed* version of it."

links.title: The Deserter: ""That's right. Some *advertising* c..."
links.text: "That's right. Some *advertising* cockroaches erected a cynical, *deconstruction* of it. We tore it down with honest working class plastic explosives -- and there it is again..." He shakes his head in disgust.

links.title: You: ""I don't know.""
links.text: "I don't know."

links.title: The Deserter: ""I do. Some *advertising* cockroach..."
links.text: "I do. Some *advertising* cockroaches used their accumulated capital to erect a new, ironic version of it. We tore it down with honest working class plastic explosives -- but there it is again, grinning..." He shakes his head in disgust.

links.title: You: ""Good. Now that that's settled...""
links.text: "Good. Now that that's settled..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Mhm," he sputters attentively."
links.text: "Mhm," he sputters attentively.

links.title: You: ""You mentioned the Union is social-..."
links.text: "You mentioned the Union is social-democratic -- and Mr. Claire a farce of a social-democrat."

links.title: The Deserter: ""I don't want to talk about god dam..."
links.text: "I don't want to talk about god damn social democrats. Traitors is all they are. Brain dead..." He waves his arm, agitated and despondent at the same time.

links.title: Empathy: "René still presses on his mind."
links.text: René still presses on his mind.

links.title: The Deserter: ""Another hideous disappointment..."..."
links.text: "Another hideous disappointment..." He pokes at the ash: "Unions are the *real* enemy; the true enemy of the proletariat, placating the masses."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Disappointment -- so personal. He d..."
links.text: Disappointment -- so personal. He displays a familiarity with the Union's top brass.

links.title: You: ""Who's a disappointment -- Evrart C..."
links.text: "Who's a disappointment -- Evrart Claire?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""That deformed toad? I wouldn't exp..."
links.text: "That deformed toad? I wouldn't expect him to wipe his own ass. I mean the *brains* of the operation. The smart one."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Edgar!"
links.text: Edgar!

links.title: You: ""You mean Edgar, Evrart's brother?""
links.text: "You mean Edgar, Evrart's brother?"

links.title: The Deserter: "The old man chortles with a nod. "H..."
links.text: The old man chortles with a nod. "He talks a big game about *uprising* and *social base* -- they must have sent the smart one to some University in Le Jardin where it's 'alienation' this and 'hegemony' that..."

links.title: Suggestion: "He's been sweet-talked by this Edga..."
links.text: He's been sweet-talked by this Edgar. They must've met in person for such animosity to have developed.

links.title: You: ""We're not the first people you've..."
links.text: "We're not the first people you've met from the city, are we?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""You can't live alone..." He's stop..."
links.text: "You can't live alone..." He's stopped poking at the ash now, just shakes his head.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The Claires wouldn't miss a man hi..."
links.text: "The Claires wouldn't miss a man hidden in their own back yard -- not all this time. Nothing happens in Martinaise without them knowing."

links.title: Logic: "Of course. Maybe the Claires asked..."
links.text: Of course. Maybe the Claires asked him to...

links.title: Logic: "The Claires know everything about M..."
links.text: The Claires know everything about Martinaise, of course they know him too! Maybe they asked him to...

links.title: Suggestion: "Don't go straight for the kill, exh..."
links.text: Don't go straight for the kill, exhaust everything else first, soften him up...

links.title: You: ""Have you approached them?""
links.text: "Have you approached them?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""I haven't approached anyone! I've..."
links.text: "I haven't approached anyone! I've hid. It was Edgar who came to me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""How did he know you were here?""
links.text: "How did he know you were here?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""He didn't just stumble in like an..."
links.text: "He didn't just stumble in like an oaf," he nods to you. "He figured it out. Some kids told him about a monster on the island. I told you, he has brains." He points to the path leading to the tower.

links.title: The Deserter: ""Stepped right off the boat and wal..."
links.text: "Stepped right off the boat and walked down where you came. I even kept the door open for him -- thought he was a man of the left. Wouldn't rat me out."

links.title: The Deserter: "He shrugs. "I was right about one o..."
links.text: He shrugs. "I was right about one of those things."

links.title: You: ""How did he know you were here?""
links.text: "How did he know you were here?"

links.title: You: ""When was this?""
links.text: "When was this?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Twenty years ago. Neither of them..."
links.text: "Twenty years ago. Neither of them could *walk* now, could they? They were less fat then."

links.title: Logic: "That's around the time the Claires..."
links.text: That's around the time the Claires came to power.

links.title: You: ""What did you talk about?""
links.text: "What did you talk about?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Edgar did the talking. Paid his *r..."
links.text: "Edgar did the talking. Paid his *respects*, like I were a fossil in a uniform. Offered platitudes about *the struggle*, flaunted his pink degree. Even quoted Mazov."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Never trust a social democrat who..."
links.text: "Never trust a social democrat who quotes Mazov..." he suddenly remembers: "Oh, and charity too. They love their charity -- offered me blankets and social housing. I still have the gas cooker he brought."

links.title: You: ""And he let you be here?""
links.text: "And he let you be here?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""*Let* me be here?" He looks around..."
links.text: "*Let* me be here?" He looks around. "The ZoC is an unlawful successor of the Commune of Revachol. We took this fortification from the loyalists. Even the Claires understand this..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "They let him be here. 'Understandin..."
links.text: They let him be here. 'Understanding' was a courtesy -- but why such a courtesy?

links.title: You: ""Mr. Dros, did you kill the Krenel..."
links.text: "Mr. Dros, did you kill the Krenel mercenary for the Claires? To incite a riot?" (Proceed.)

links.title: The Deserter: ""I'm not doing anything for that sw..."
links.text: "I'm not doing anything for that swine again." He shakes his head.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Again? What have you done for Edga..."
links.text: "Again? What have you done for Edgar before?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Tried teaching him some Mazovian s..."
links.text: "Tried teaching him some Mazovian socio-economics. They didn't stick. We parted ways." He coughs.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Okay, he didn't do the hanged man f..."
links.text: Okay, he didn't do the hanged man for them. But he's insinuating something.

links.title: Drama: "There is more here, you can feel it..."
links.text: There is more here, you can feel it. He was not outright lying but almost...

links.title: Rhetoric: "That is a euphemism."
links.text: That is a euphemism.

links.title: Drama: "There is more here, but you may not..."
links.text: There is more here, but you may not have the information to pry it loose from him...

links.title: Inland Empire: "This has to be one of the mysteries..."
links.text: This has to be one of the mysteries you never got to solve...

links.title: Volition: "Get over it, proceed!"
links.text: Get over it, proceed!

links.title: Inland Empire: "You have a feeling there was more h..."
links.text: You have a feeling there was more here, but what? This has to be one of the mysteries you don't get to solve...

links.title: Logic: "Nothing mysterious about missing on..."
links.text: Nothing mysterious about missing one thing in a hundred. Dust yourself off and proceed.

links.title: You: ""Again? What have you done for him..."
links.text: "Again? What have you done for him before?"

links.title: You: ""Let's let this one slide.""
links.text: "Let's let this one slide."

links.title: The Deserter: ""First against the wall with them,"..."
links.text: "First against the wall with them," he sputters. "First against the wall, for keeping the mills of capital. They should go *before* the owners..."

links.title: You: ""You've talked to Edgar?""
links.text: "You've talked to Edgar?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""First against the wall with him......"
links.text: "First against the wall with him..." He's stopped poking at the ash now, just shakes his head.

links.title: You: ""Okay, got it.""
links.text: "Okay, got it."

links.title: The Deserter: ""First against the wall with them,"..."
links.text: "First against the wall with them," he sputters. "First against the wall. For keeping the mills of capital going. They should go *before* the owners."

links.title: You: ""Doesn't Evrart run the Union?""
links.text: "Doesn't Evrart run the Union?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""That mobster toad couldn't run a s..."
links.text: "That mobster toad couldn't run a shit-house. He has *no* political education. His twin, Edgar Claire, that one's been to one of those East Revachol Universities. He talks a big game about uprising and alienation and so on..."

links.title: You: ""Got it.""
links.text: "Got it."

links.title: The Deserter: ""First against the wall with them,"..."
links.text: "First against the wall with them," he sputters. "Keeping the mills running, collaborants, the whole lot. They should go *before* the owners..."

links.title: You: "What was the deal between him and E..."
links.text: What was the deal between him and Edgar?

links.title: Logic: "The connection comes to you, like a..."
links.text: The connection comes to you, like a splash of cold water. Dark, cold water...

links.title: You: ""Twenty years ago, when you met Edg..."
links.text: "Twenty years ago, when you met Edgar. The Claires didn't run the Union yet, did they?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Heh..." A sputter from the old man..."
links.text: "Heh..." A sputter from the old man.

links.title: Logic: "He acknowledges it. Here we go, a t..."
links.text: He acknowledges it. Here we go, a twist, behind the dark bend...

links.title: You: ""Who *did*?""
links.text: "Who *did*?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""That bourgeois cow... Tiphaine Hol..."
links.text: "That bourgeois cow... Tiphaine Holly was her name." He narrows his eyes. "Licked the rich man's hand every time he came to town. Never seen a labour leader so hot on mutual cooperation..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""And money -- she liked that too. T..."
links.text: "And money -- she liked that too. That Holly was a real bridge-builder and a deal-maker..." His eyes glisten suddenly, with hatred.

links.title: Half Light: "Bordering on sentimentality, it dri..."
links.text: Bordering on sentimentality, it drips out of him. Tempered by something familiar to you. A familiar rage.

links.title: You: ""She was also a woman, wasn't she?..."
links.text: "She was also a woman, wasn't she? Like that Klaasje..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""She was. And she was real soft on..."
links.text: "She was. And she was real soft on those money-men. Had a Barbara Muskova bag over her shoulder that she liked to bring to work..."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Barbara Muskova and Numb 12, Joyce..."
links.text: Barbara Muskova and Numb 12, Joyce Messier's choices...

links.title: You: ""Women do like their Barbara Muskov..."
links.text: "Women do like their Barbara Muskova and their Numb 12..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Mmmhm... She'd probably spray a ta..."
links.text: "Mmmhm... She'd probably spray a tanker full of that *shit* on her. Of course, I never got close enough to smell it..."

links.title: You: ""And then she just... disappeared.""
links.text: "And then she just... disappeared."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Called in they say -- on the eve o..."
links.text: "Called in they say -- on the eve of battle. Ran away. Vanished like a piss-stain..." He squints and smiles at the black logs.

links.title: Logic: "No. That's not quite it, is it?"
links.text: No. That's not quite it, is it?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Did she?" The lieutenant's voice i..."
links.text: "Did she?" The lieutenant's voice is calm. "They say her *daughter* called in, not her personally. But that wasn't really her daughter, was it?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""No, I guess it was not..." You cou..."
links.text: "No, I guess it was not..." You could swear you see the embers glow again, under his eyes on the dust.

links.title: You: ""Edgar had someone make the call --..."
links.text: "Edgar had someone make the call -- why is that, Mr. Dros?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""She couldn't make the call herself.""
links.text: "She couldn't make the call herself."

links.title: Logic: "Here it is. The bend in the river....."
links.text: Here it is. The bend in the river...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "The truth!"
links.text: The truth!

links.title: You: ""Why?""
links.text: "Why?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Because she was dead.""
links.text: "Because she was dead."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Just say nothing."
links.text: Just say nothing.

links.title: You: ""How come?""
links.text: "How come?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Because the cow caught a bullet in..."
links.text: "Because the cow caught a bullet in her right lung. Fell into the canal grasping her tit and drowned. Or bled -- hard to say. It was a sloppy job. On a moving target."

links.title: The Deserter: ""She was going home, waddling. Dres..."
links.text: "She was going home, waddling. Dressed in yellow. Drunk like she often was. The ruins were black around her and she had a yellow leather bag under her arm. She tried to cross the canal."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Heading home to Grand Couron or Be..."
links.text: "Heading home to Grand Couron or Betancourt... Some place like that. Where they build those new batiments for the people who flourish in the hell around her. And the ruins..."

links.title: Drama: "Be abstract here. A bit of drama."
links.text: Be abstract here. A bit of drama.

links.title: You: ""You killed her?""
links.text: "You killed her?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""*Someone* did," he shrugs. His eye..."
links.text: "*Someone* did," he shrugs. His eyes grow cold suddenly. "Or maybe the cow just fell. The past is blurry, all I know is..."

links.title: Half Light: "Another, big spike of rage. Differe..."
links.text: Another, big spike of rage. Different from the one he has for her...

links.title: The Deserter: ""Nothing changed. Not in the *mater..."
links.text: "Nothing changed. Not in the *material base*, not in the *hegemony*, there was no uprising. Just words... The Union fizzled, sogged. Nothing came of it. Nothing."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Edgar didn't keep his part of the..."
links.text: "Edgar didn't keep his part of the deal."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Heh..." A sputter again, nothing m..."
links.text: "Heh..." A sputter again, nothing more.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If you were to testify to this --..."
links.text: "If you were to testify to this -- give the RCM something on Edgar -- you could walk." The lieutenant says in a voice even calmer, as if it were nothing at all.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We would strike everything you've..."
links.text: "We would strike everything you've done and process you as a POW. You were in a war. You were on assignment. We could even extradite you to the Samaran People's Republic."

links.title: The Deserter: ""A degenerate workers' state? Goat..."
links.text: "A degenerate workers' state? Goat shit? No, thank you. I'm Revacholian," he spits. "My days are short. I will rot away here -- in a Moralintern cell. I will not testify to anything." He coughs.

links.title: Suggestion: "C'mon. Just a little. You're buddie..."
links.text: C'mon. Just a little. You're buddies.

links.title: Half Light: "Threaten with PAIN. All human being..."
links.text: Threaten with PAIN. All human beings respect pain. It's the truth.

links.title: Cuno: ""Slippery fuck didn't keep his word..."
links.text: "Slippery fuck didn't keep his word..." The kid's been listening, mouth agape.

links.title: The Deserter: ""Heh..." a sputter again. "Now that..."
links.text: "Heh..." a sputter again. "Now that sounds like you want me to *testify* in your charade of law. My days are numbered. Let them rot away in a Moralintern cell -- I've said all I will." He coughs.

links.title: You: ""We have ways to make you talk -- i..."
links.text: "We have ways to make you talk -- in that Moralintern cell."

links.title: The Deserter: ""I didn't live and fight for forty..."
links.text: "I didn't live and fight for forty years to end up as a collaborationist. I've heard it -- on Channel 8, 40AM *and* Radio Revachol Late Night..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Everyone is a blobber in this worl..."
links.text: "Everyone is a blobber in this world. Everyone betrays everyone. They're all already locked up -- for betrayal. The best ones, the ones with heart, were slaughtered, trampled..." He looks to the city.

links.title: You: ""You can tell me, here. It won't be..."
links.text: "You can tell me, here. It won't be *that* usable."

links.title: The Deserter: ""I haven't lived and fought for for..."
links.text: "I haven't lived and fought for forty years to end up as a collaborationist. I've heard it -- on Channel 8, 40AM, Radio Revachol Late Night..."

links.title: You: ""But you did *do* it.""
links.text: "But you did *do* it."

links.title: The Deserter: ""I saw it happen and I liked it. Th..."
links.text: "I saw it happen and I liked it. That's all I have to say. I didn't live and fight for forty years to end up as a collaborationist. I've heard it on Channel 8, 40AM, Radio Revachol Late Night..."

links.title: You: ""Okay then. That's that." (Point to..."
links.text: "Okay then. That's that." (Point to your head.) "But I know."

links.title: The Deserter: ""All you know is I saw it happen --..."
links.text: "All you know is I saw it happen -- and I liked it. I liked it a lot. Her plump body, bobbing up and down in that canal like a cork. That chick-yellow bag still on her, strangling her..." Cold black coals look at the canal, then at you -- blink.

links.title: Empathy: "The same old freezing hatred."
links.text: The same old freezing hatred.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "There is *plenty* here to work with..."
links.text: There is *plenty* here to work with once he's in custody -- and the lieutenant knows it. He gives you a little nod to proceed.

links.title: Authority: "There is *plenty* here to work with..."
links.text: There is *plenty* here to work with once he's in custody -- proceed with a sure hand now!

links.title: You: ""Edgar didn't keep his part of the..."
links.text: "Edgar didn't keep his part of the deal."

links.title: You: ""You shot her.""
links.text: "You shot her."

links.title: The Deserter: ""*Someone* shot her," he shrugs. Hi..."
links.text: "*Someone* shot her," he shrugs. His eyes grow cold suddenly. "Or maybe the cow just fell. My memory is full of holes. All I know is..."

links.title: You: ""It was you." (Make a motion, like..."
links.text: "It was you." (Make a motion, like shooting a rifle.)

links.title: The Deserter: ""Heh." He does not fall for it. "It..."
links.text: "Heh." He does not fall for it. "It was someone. *Someone* shot her," he shrugs. His eyes grow cold suddenly.

links.title: The Deserter: ""Or maybe she just fell. I get thes..."
links.text: "Or maybe she just fell. I get these violent ideations.... My memory is filled with holes, especially the Thirties. All I know is..."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: The Deserter: ""The cow caught a bullet in her rig..."
links.text: "The cow caught a bullet in her right lung, fell into the canal grasping her tit and drowned. Or bled -- hard to say. It was a sloppy job. And a moving target."

links.title: You: ""But did she? They say it was her d..."
links.text: "But did she? They say it was her daughter who called in for her. That wasn't her daughter, was it?"

links.title: Logic: "Oh no, the connection doesn't come..."
links.text: Oh no, the connection doesn't come to you! On such a *pivotal* moment...

links.title: Authority: "Dumbo, do something, you can't zone..."
links.text: Dumbo, do something, you can't zone out now, this isn't doodle-loo dance time.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Slap yourself in your head again, j..."
links.text: Slap yourself in your head again, jump start it!

links.title: You: "Wait. It was about him meeting Edga..."
links.text: Wait. It was about him meeting Edgar, and a deal...

links.title: Logic: "By god, we are on the edge! In the..."
links.text: By god, we are on the edge! In the very end -- and you can't even remember what you're trying to connect, can you? While the murder suspect stares at you with contempt!

links.title: You: ""Something with the Union boss..."..."
links.text: "Something with the Union boss..." (Punch yourself in the head.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer!" The lieutenant watches y..."
links.text: "Officer!" The lieutenant watches you beat yourself in the head -- to make a connection in the murder case.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "He quickly realises what is happeni..."
links.text: He quickly realises what is happening.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mr. Dros, about this deal you made..."
links.text: "Mr. Dros, about this deal you made." He turns to him. "With Edgar. The death of the Krenel mercenary was only *coincidentally* beneficial to the Claires. But..." He leans closer.

links.title: Cuno: "The kid watches you violently beat..."
links.text: The kid watches you violently beat yourself in the head -- in order to make a connection in the murder case.

links.title: The Deserter: "The communist watches you violently..."
links.text: The communist watches you violently beat yourself in the head to make a connection in his case. It yields no revelations.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "God dammit. Why are you so stupid?..."
links.text: God dammit. Why are you so stupid? That's it -- we're aborting this mental failure. Back to questions.

links.title: You: ""Something with the Union boss... t..."
links.text: "Something with the Union boss... the elections. The previous leader..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""What?" He's beginning to sense it..."
links.text: "What?" He's beginning to sense it now. Something is off.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "To your right you see the lieutenan..."
links.text: To your right you see the lieutenant give you a quick sideways glance...

links.title: Cuno: ""Yo, Cuno doesn't understand what's..."
links.text: "Yo, Cuno doesn't understand what's goin' on here. Get a hold of it, detective Dick, let's move on, okay?"

links.title: Composure: "You *have* to straighten your back..."
links.text: You *have* to straighten your back and get back to it now. You're the last detective of the RCM here. Finish the interrogation, it doesn't matter if you forgot one thing.

links.title: Volition: "Get a hold of yourself, this is jus..."
links.text: Get a hold of yourself, this is just one little thing. You still have everything else! Go on, finish the interrogation!

links.title: Authority: "There is no other officer on the sc..."
links.text: There is no other officer on the scene, only you. You *have* to get a hold of yourself -- finish the interrogation.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Get your head back in the game. Eve..."
links.text: Get your head back in the game. Everyone else is gone. It has to be you, finish the damn interrogation, forget this.

links.title: Volition: "NOW!"
links.text: NOW!

links.title: You: ""Kim, what do you think? About this..."
links.text: "Kim, what do you think? About this... you know..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""About this deal you made." The lie..."
links.text: "About this deal you made." The lieutenant immediately understands what is happening, and turns to the suspect.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""With Edgar. The death of the Krene..."
links.text: "With Edgar. The death of the Krenel mercenary was only *coincidentally* beneficial to the Claires. But..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What about the *other* people you'..."
links.text: "What about the *other* people you've killed for them?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Other people?""
links.text: "Other people?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Like -- the previous forewoman of..."
links.text: "Like -- the previous forewoman of the Union."

links.title: Logic: "That's it! That's what you weren't..."
links.text: That's it! That's what you weren't connecting yourself...

links.title: The Deserter: ""I didn't fight forty years to end..."
links.text: "I didn't fight forty years to end up an informant for the international regime." He wags a finger at the lieutenant. "What happened happened."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Still dumb, your eyes are transfixe..."
links.text: Still dumb, your eyes are transfixed on his digit. It's yellow with nicotine...

links.title: Logic: "Before, when you asked him about th..."
links.text: Before, when you asked him about the Union he said it was a *disappointment*. They promised him something. Political.

links.title: You: ""They promised political change. An..."
links.text: "They promised political change. And they didn't deliver."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Look who's up." He scoffs. "You're..."
links.text: "Look who's up." He scoffs. "You're worse off than me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We will have plenty of time to tal..."
links.text: "We will have plenty of time to talk about this, Mr. Dros." He does not let him gloat. "When you're in pre-detention -- it takes *years* in pre-detention."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Go ahead." The straggler closes hi..."
links.text: "Go ahead." The straggler closes his gap toothed smiled. "I've been in solitary confinement my whole life."

links.title: Volition: "Ease off it. This was not an unmiti..."
links.text: Ease off it. This was not an unmitigated disaster. The lieutenant mitigated it. Just proceed, calmly...

links.title: You: ""Kim, we're not solving this part...."
links.text: "Kim, we're not solving this part. What do we do?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Look who's up!" He grins at you. "..."
links.text: "Look who's up!" He grins at you. "From the drunken stupor. This one's worse for wear than me... emotionally frayed. Life is hard for us human beings in deregulation hell, isn't it?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We will have plenty of time to tal..."
links.text: "We will have plenty of time to talk about this later, Mr. Dros." The lieutenant does not let him gloat. "When you're in pre-detention -- it can take *years* in pre-detention."

links.title: You: ""You fucking killed the previous fo..."
links.text: "You fucking killed the previous foreman. I know it."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Look who's up!" he grins at you. "..."
links.text: "Look who's up!" he grins at you. "From the drunken stupor. This one's worse for wear than me... and so emotional. Life is hard for us human beings in deregulation hell, isn't it?"

links.title: You: "That's it? I've gotta say that? The..."
links.text: That's it? I've gotta say that? There are no other thoughts in my head?

links.title: Perception (Sight): "You could say he has dirty fingerna..."
links.text: You could say he has dirty fingernails, but that's just a fact, it's not going to do anything.

links.title: Logic: "That's, regrettably, all you've got..."
links.text: That's, regrettably, all you've got, yes.

links.title: Authority: "You are *THE LAW*. He must divulge..."
links.text: You are *THE LAW*. He must divulge the information!

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Slap yourself in your head, jump st..."
links.text: Slap yourself in your head, jump start it!

links.title: You: ""The *boom-boom-boom morons* on the..."
links.text: "The *boom-boom-boom morons* on the ice..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""They're morons, duped by bourgeois..."
links.text: "They're morons, duped by bourgeois culture. What *more* is there to say? I've seen their kind -- pop up, like worms after the rain." He makes an erratic gesture of annoyance.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Oh, there's plenty to say, hard-cor..."
links.text: Oh, there's plenty to say, hard-core man.

links.title: You: ""You know, those beats are actually..."
links.text: "You know, those beats are actually quite *progressive*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think now is the time for..."
links.text: "I don't think now is the time for this, officer." The lieutenant tries to nip it...

links.title: Conceptualization: "...to no avail!"
links.text: ...to no avail!

links.title: You: ""Regressive beats." (Nod.) "The bea..."
links.text: "Regressive beats." (Nod.) "The beats still have a long way to go."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think now is the time for..."
links.text: "I don't think now is the time for this, officer." The lieutenant tries to nip it...

links.title: Conceptualization: "...to no avail!"
links.text: ...to no avail!

links.title: You: ""Good, traditional Revacholian beat..."
links.text: "Good, traditional Revacholian beats. Not moronic at all."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think now is the time for..."
links.text: "I don't think now is the time for this, officer." The lieutenant tries to nip it...

links.title: Conceptualization: "...to no avail!"
links.text: ...to no avail!

links.title: You: ""Indeed. What more could there poss..."
links.text: "Indeed. What more could there possibly be to say about those beats."

links.title: The Deserter: ""*Beats...*" The old man scoffs. "V..."
links.text: "*Beats...*" The old man scoffs. "Violent bourgeois language. Even music is a form of homicidal competition. Saxophone blowing anti-communism..." His voice trails off into a gust of sea wind.

links.title: Rhetoric: "What more is there to say? You've *..."
links.text: What more is there to say? You've *always* got *something to say.

links.title: You: ""I let them in the church. The boom..."
links.text: "I let them in the church. The boom-boom is now in the church."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think now is the time for..."
links.text: "I don't think now is the time for this, officer." The lieutenant tries to nip it..

links.title: Rhetoric: "...to no avail!"
links.text: ...to no avail!

links.title: The Deserter: ""I saw you." The old man nods. "Ser..."
links.text: "I saw you." The old man nods. "Serves that pigsty right to have them in there. Ghoulish sarcophagus, the Ecclesiastes are all paedophiles..." His voice trails off into a gust of sea wind, he looks at the church on the coast.

links.title: You: ""It was I who cleared them from the..."
links.text: "It was I who cleared them from the ice."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't think now is the time for..."
links.text: "I don't think now is the time for this, officer." The lieutenant tries to nip it...

links.title: Rhetoric: "...to no avail!"
links.text: ...to no avail!

links.title: The Deserter: ""I saw you." The old man nods. "I d..."
links.text: "I saw you." The old man nods. "I didn't think you'd be *proud* of it -- evicting mentally handicapped vagrants," he shrugs. "But that's property law for you. I wouldn't be surprised if a Frittte sprung up on the ice, tomorrow..."

links.title: You: ""Indeed." (Don't tell him.)"
links.text: "Indeed." (Don't tell him.)

links.title: The Deserter: ""I've heard it on the radio too, th..."
links.text: "I've heard it on the radio too, that boom-boom. It's the same violent decadence all over again for the hundredth time... Misanthropy masquerading as culture."

links.title: You: ""The blood-drenched soucriant on he..."
links.text: "The blood-drenched soucriant on her boat -- what is a soucriant?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Who fucking cares?" It does not se..."
links.text: "Who fucking cares?" It does not seem to strike a fire in him anymore...

links.title: The Deserter: ""Your beloved *Joyce Messier*. A so..."
links.text: "Your beloved *Joyce Messier*. A soucriant. A blood sucker. Women like her *feed* on the life energy of young working class men. And they *let* her."

links.title: The Deserter: ""I can't *believe* the inert lumpen..."
links.text: "I can't *believe* the inert lumpen out there. They just let her drive her little boat like that. No violence, not even a robbery. The working class has lost their appetite for justice..." His voice trails off in disappointment.

links.title: Hand/Eye Coordination: "If only he had the ammunition."
links.text: If only he had the ammunition.

links.title: The Deserter: ""Your beloved *representative of th..."
links.text: "Your beloved *representative of the harbour company* is a soucriant. I saw her. Women like her *feed* on the life energy of young working class men. And they *let* her."

links.title: The Deserter: ""A soucriant, a blood-sucker, the r..."
links.text: "A soucriant, a blood-sucker, the rich whore on her boat."

links.title: You: ""Oh, you mean Joyce.""
links.text: "Oh, you mean Joyce."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Women like her *feed* on the life..."
links.text: "Women like her *feed* on the life energy of young working class men." He nods. "And they *let* her...."

links.title: You: ""Oh, you mean the company represent..."
links.text: "Oh, you mean the company representative."

links.title: You: ""You know, about that René...""
links.text: "You know, about that René..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Yes, where is he?" he tenses up. "..."
links.text: "Yes, where is he?" he tenses up. "I hope he doesn't have *debilitating* arthritis. Or kidney stones. He can still come out to play with balls and get shot in the head, right?"

links.title: Empathy: "Oh my, god, he's even *worried* for..."
links.text: Oh my, god, he's even *worried* for him.

links.title: You: ""René is dead. He died of old age,..."
links.text: "René is dead. He died of old age, a couple of days ago."

links.title: The Deserter: ""No...""
You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: The Deserter: ""I waited too long…" The old commun..."
links.text: "I waited too long…" The old communard looks at you, his blackberry eyes shaking -- in disbelief. "I waited too long and now he's dead."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm sorry, Mr. Dros," the lieutena..."
links.text: "I'm sorry, Mr. Dros," the lieutenant says, softly. "I understand you knew him for a long time."

links.title: The Deserter: ""They're all dead now." He just sha..."
links.text: "They're all dead now." He just shakes his head. "Fuck it..."

links.title: Logic: "If he really wanted to kill him so..."
links.text: If he really wanted to kill him so bad, he would have done. There must have been a thousand *black days* on these islands, his health ailing.

links.title: You: ""You had a thousand chances to kill..."
links.text: "You had a thousand chances to kill him."

links.title: The Deserter: ""And I blew them all. What does it..."
links.text: "And I blew them all. What does it matter now? He's gone. Ancient dust."

links.title: Empathy: "He reminded him of himself. The sam..."
links.text: He reminded him of himself. The same hatred. The same... You try to think of something else, but no, it's just hatred.

links.title: You: ""You cared about him?""
links.text: "You cared about him?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""All human beings care about each o..."
links.text: "All human beings care about each other." A little flash of anger. "I cared for... seeing his head explode. And now... god damn this world."

links.title: You: ""I'm sorry.""
links.text: "I'm sorry."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Fuck you..." the old communard say..."
links.text: "Fuck you..." the old communard says -- staring at the ground -- seemingly to the island you're on.

links.title: You: ""Are you okay Mr. Dros? To go on?""
links.text: "Are you okay Mr. Dros? To go on?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""You think I haven't seen people di..."
links.text: "You think I haven't seen people die? It's all I've seen them do. Fuck and die -- all the other plans we had. To love. To colonize the pale. It's all fucked..."

links.title: Volition: "He's not okay. This is just another..."
links.text: He's not okay. This is just another black day, in a row of black days -- something *strange* is keeping him together, making him endure...

links.title: Conceptualization: "...an idea. Told to him by grown up..."
links.text: ...an idea. Told to him by grown ups, from radio towers and leaflets, in beautiful print when he was still a teenager: everything is possible. If we fight.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "And then he lost. So did they all."
links.text: And then he lost. So did they all.

links.title: Empathy: "It doesn't look like he is. Okay."
links.text: It doesn't look like he is. Okay.

links.title: You: ""Just kidding...""
links.text: "Just kidding..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""No you're not! He wouldn't go away..."
links.text: "No you're not! He wouldn't go away for so long..." The old communard looks at you -- his blackberry eyes shaking in disbelief. "I waited too long... I waited too long and now he's dead."

links.title: You: ""Bad arthritis, yes. He's not playi..."
links.text: "Bad arthritis, yes. He's not playing this week." (Lie.)

links.title: The Deserter: ""Heh, yes of course." He seems to r..."
links.text: "Heh, yes of course." He seems to relax a bit. "I hope it hurts like hell, I hope he sweats blood. Must be torture -- not to be throwing his balls for a *whole week*..."

links.title: Empathy: "He was worried for him."
links.text: He was worried for him.

links.title: Suggestion: "He reminds him of himself. The same..."
links.text: He reminds him of himself. The same hatred. The same... you try to think of another thing -- but no, it's just the hatred.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "They are veterans of the same war...."
links.text: They are veterans of the same war. Somewhere west, in Coal City his enemy is lying in a dark room, on a metal slider. In L'Ossuaire Municipal, like he will too. Soon. Half of the war between these men is over.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "With an agitated gait Satellite-Off..."
links.text: With an agitated gait Satellite-Officer Jean-Heron Vicquemare paces the jetty, 22 kilometres East -- in Martinaise: "What could he *possibly* be doing there for so long," he says.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""Policework?" Patrol Officer Judit..."
links.text: "Policework?" Patrol Officer Judit Minot replies, with a tinge of hope in her voice. A tinge of warmth too, against the cold air rising from the water...

links.title: Rhetoric: "He's drunk, she thinks. And we all..."
links.text: He's drunk, she thinks. And we all know it. Still, she's just *trying* to see it in a  generous light...

links.title: Empathy: "He seems relieved. Could he have be..."
links.text: He seems relieved. Could he have been worried for him?

links.title: You: ""Anyway. Tell me something else, Mr..."
links.text: "Anyway. Tell me something else, Mr. Dros..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Heh, yes, of course..." He mutters..."
links.text: "Heh, yes, of course..." He mutters to himself. "Must be passing a kidney stone. I hope it's excruciating. At least it keeps him from throwing his balls..."

links.title: You: ""By the 'cock parading in his colou..."
links.text: "By the 'cock parading in his colourful uniform,' you mean *René*?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Every *fucking* morning, for thirt..."
links.text: "Every *fucking* morning, for thirty-four years..." He grinds his teeth in rage. "Throwing that ball. One ball against the other... I've always loathed that game. That is *not* a working class game. I don't care what they say on Radio June."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Royalist ghouls play it like it wa..."
links.text: "Royalist ghouls play it like it was *life itself*! Click-clack," he makes the sound of balls connecting, "across the water each day. And that uniform, like a parrot's plumage! I won't even mention that he's a traitor to his *race*. A pétanque maniac *race traitor*."

links.title: You: "Just nod."
links.text: Just nod.

links.title: The Deserter: ""I remember him..." He points to hi..."
links.text: "I remember him..." He points to his black eye. "I remember him from *La Noce* -- not him personally, his make and model. There were tens of thousands of them. I thought we took them all out before the liberals came to their rescue. We missed one..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""*That* one." With his shaky finger..."
links.text: "*That* one." With his shaky finger he points to the city, toward the crater near the plaza where a lonely pine tree stands.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "There doesn't seem to be a single p..."
links.text: There doesn't seem to be a single person under the pine today. Not even Gaston, alone.

links.title: You: ""There's no one there...""
links.text: "There's no one there..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Fat and plump, like a pheasant..."..."
links.text: "Fat and plump, like a pheasant..." He does not hear you. "Just *begging* to be popped off." A grin stretches across his face and he says very softly: "Please, Mr. Dros. Shoot me."

links.title: You: "Just nod."
links.text: Just nod.

links.title: The Deserter: ""Fat and plump. Like a pheasant, ju..."
links.text: "Fat and plump. Like a pheasant, just *begging* to be popped off...." A grin stretches across his face and he whispers: "Please, Mr. Dros. Shoot me."

links.title: Half Light: "He whispers with such predatory hun..."
links.text: He whispers with such predatory hunger it borders on *longing*.

links.title: You: ""You'd like to kill him?""
links.text: "You'd like to kill him?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""Not yet. I like to *look* at him s..."
links.text: "Not yet. I like to *look* at him strut around, place the cross-hair on his medals." The smile lingers. "Right on his face, and just... fiddle the trigger. *Think* about it. Let the bon-bon melt in my mouth..."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "A treat. Better served for later......"
links.text: A treat. Better served for later... he's a pleasure delayer.

links.title: You: ""Save the treat for later?""
links.text: "Save the treat for later?"

links.title: The Deserter: ""He *is* a juicy bon-bon, that one...."
links.text: "He *is* a juicy bon-bon, that one. A real treat. For the black day -- the blackest. When I put that gun in my own mouth. I think: no, don't waste it. Put this lead in that cock René. For the boys he killed -- and then I look at him throw those balls and I suddenly feel..." He lets out a wistful sigh.

links.title: The Deserter: ""Better. I even hid one bullet so I..."
links.text: "Better. I even hid one bullet so I'd always have one. For him..." The lines on his face straighten as he looks inland. "Haven't seen him there lately... must be down with arthritis. Old cunt..."

links.title: Suggestion: "Hearing it may destabilize him -- y..."
links.text: Hearing it may destabilize him -- you sure you've gotten everything from him?

links.title: Empathy: "Momentarily he's worried for him. H..."
links.text: Momentarily he's worried for him. He reminds him of himself. The same hatred. The same... you try to think of another thing -- but no, it's just the hatred.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "They are veterans of the same war...."
links.text: They are veterans of the same war. Somewhere west, in Coal City his enemy is lying in a dark room, on a metal slider, not breathing. Like he will too. Soon. Half of the war between these men is over.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "With an agitated gait Satellite-Off..."
links.text: With an agitated gait Satellite-Officer Jean-Heron Vicquemare paces the jetty, 22 kilometres East -- in Martinaise: "What could he *possibly* be doing there for so long," he says.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""Policework?" Patrol Officer Judit..."
links.text: "Policework?" Patrol Officer Judit Minot replies, with a tinge of hope in her voice. A tinge of warmth too, against the cold air rising from the water...

links.title: Rhetoric: "He's drunk, she thinks. And we all..."
links.text: He's drunk, she thinks. And we all know it. Still, she's just *trying* to see it in a  generous light...

links.title: You: "Nod."
links.text: Nod.

links.title: The Deserter: ""He *is* a juicy bon-bon, that one...."
links.text: "He *is* a juicy bon-bon, that one. A real treat. For the black day -- the blackest. When I put that gun in my own mouth. I think: no, don't waste it. Put this lead in that cock René. For the boys he killed -- and then I look at him throw those balls and I suddenly feel..." He lets out a wistful sigh.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Save the treat for later?" the lie..."
links.text: "Save the treat for later?" the lieutenant asks cheerfully.

links.title: Cuno: ""Sometimes Cuno likes to look at th..."
links.text: "Sometimes Cuno likes to look at the baggie before he does it. Just look at that fat baggie..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""A real treat. For the black day --..."
links.text: "A real treat. For the black day -- the blackest day," he says, almost salivating. "When I put the gun in my own mouth, I always think: No. Put this lead in that cock René. And I go to look at him throw those balls. And I suddenly feel..." He breathes out.

links.title: You: ""Let's definitely back off now. Cal..."
links.text: "Let's definitely back off now. Calm down."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Calm down? I'm not angry..." His h..."
links.text: "Calm down? I'm not angry..." His hand still trembles. "I *adore* him. He reminds me of everything we fought for. At least we killed that Frissel and his kingsmen..." He's overtaken by a coughing fit.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "There doesn't seem to be a single p..."
links.text: There doesn't seem to be a single person under the pine today...

links.title: You: ""Now I don't know about...""
links.text: "Now I don't know about..."

links.title: You: ""Whoa-whoa. Let's back off before y..."
links.text: "Whoa-whoa. Let's back off before you get too agitated."

links.title: The Deserter: ""What is there to be *agitated* abo..."
links.text: "What is there to be *agitated* about? The unholy ghoul?!" His hand trembles with rage. "I love him there. He reminds me of everything we fought for. At least we killed that Frissel and his kingsmen..." He's overtaken by a coughing fit.

links.title: You: ""I'm glad we talked about this. Now..."
links.text: "I'm glad we talked about this. Now..."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Glad we talked about *what*?" Anot..."
links.text: "Glad we talked about *what*?" Another erratic gesture. He's trembling...

links.title: The Deserter: ""Glad? It's all gone..." He stares..."
links.text: "Glad? It's all gone..." He stares into the dust at his feet. Grey and dirty spring grass all around.

links.title: You: "Just nod."
links.text: Just nod.

links.title: The Deserter: ""We did good when we pushed him und..."
links.text: "We did good when we pushed him under that horse car. If only... in the Thirties, those *disco whores*..." What follows is ominous mumbling. You cannot make out a single word.

links.title: You: ""Okay then.""
links.text: "Okay then."

links.title: You: "Nod."
links.text: Nod.

links.title: You: "Let him finish, do not interrupt."
links.text: Let him finish, do not interrupt.

links.title: You: ""Parody of a social democrat?""
links.text: "Parody of a social democrat?"

links.title: You: ""Yeah, wait. We have more serious t..."
links.text: "Yeah, wait. We have more serious things to discuss."

links.title: The Deserter: ""Imbeciles..." The old man in the d..."
links.text: "Imbeciles..." The old man in the dirty tracksuit trousers stares at you, panting from hatred. A gust of wind blows in from the sea, bending the reeds behind him...
